The project will support the employment of approximately 10 Indigenous peoples in Ocean Cluster member organizations for 12-month placements. Participants will gain valuable experience in a new industry and will enhance their knowledge through placements that complement their existing skillset and natural aptitudes.
Project Partners: Ulnooweg Development Group, JEDI, College of the North Atlantic

Project Title: Ocean Aware This project will develop next-generation underwater observation systems for deployment in zones of high commercial interest to enable both Canadian and global ocean industries to balance business efficiency and profitability with sustainable ocean business practices. The technologies and information-sharing concepts developed will improve monitoring capabilities over wide areas of ocean and will allow such monitoring to be done more economically and more quickly.
Project Partners: Innovasea, Emera, Xeos Technologies, Dartmouth Ocean Technologies, Ocean Choice International, DFO, The Ocean Tracking Network, Irving Shipbuilding, Dalhousie University, Memorial University of Newfoundland

Project Title: Ocean Startup Through this project, partners will be supporting the development of ocean technology start-ups and increasing the industrial use of marine technologies. This innovative project will address talent challenges by growing the ocean workforce, helping new businesses hire employees with the skill sets they need. In addition, the project will encourage the participation of under-represented groups such as women and Indigenous groups in this vital economic sector.
Project Partners: The Genesis Centre, Innovacorp, PEI Bioalliance, New Brunswick Innovation Foundation, Dalhousie University, Springboard Atlantic, Mitacs, ACOA, (Provincial Governments)

Project Title: OceanVision These project partners will develop a turnkey service solution for the collection of seafloor imaging and mapping to be used by a number of ocean industries, including oil and gas, fishing, hydrographic, search and salvage, and military and defence. This new underwater service hub uses new marine technologies and products to produce high-resolution images of the seafloor, and will reduce the cost and risk of operating in ocean environments.
Project Partners: Kraken Robotics, Petroleum Research Newfoundland & Labrador, Ocean Choice International, Nunavut Fisheries Association, NRC, Government of Newfoundland

Project Title: Enhancing genomics in Canadian soybeans This project aims to establish a breeding program for non-GMO soybeans. The program will focus on breeding for competitive yield, SCN tolerance, and maturity to minimize the yield gap with GMO soybeans.
Project Partners: NRGene, Hensall Co-op, Yumasoy Foods Ltd., Pulse Genetics

Project Title: AI-Enhanced Grain Quality for Sustainable Agriculture This project will develop a solution that integrates advanced artificial intelligence and image processing technologies to provide accurate, real-time grain quality assessments using standard smartphone cameras.
Project Partners: Grain Discovery, Inarix, Sevita International

Project Title: Investing in Canada's Oat protein future This project aims to develop and scale oat fractionation technology, which will contribute to the creation of a protein ingredient used in consumer packaged goods (CPG) products.
Project Partners: One Degree Organics, Vibrant Health, No Meat Factory, Tuft and Paw

Project Title: Shooting for the Stars: Aiming for Burger Perfection The project will focus on developing a plant-based burger that mimics the taste, texture, and mouthfeel of traditional beef burgers.
Project Partners: LovinglyMade Flour Mills, Botaneco

Project Title: Lupin Loop This project aims to help develop an export market for a new lupin variety by testing its agronomy traits, functionality in ingredients and application into North American and European food product.
Project Partners: Lupin Platform

Project Title: Project Loop This project aims to bring more sustainable high-protein food options into grocery stores and to consumers. Project partners will develop faba protein and extruded ingredients, and from them, create high-protein consumer packaged goods. The consortium will also help scale up and improve current processing methods to support commercialization of the ingredient, including through the employment of a learning and information-sharing approach across the value chain.
Project Partners: Griffith Foods, Faba Canada, Botaniline, BFY Proteins

Project Title: Canadian Pilot Scale Processing of High Value Powdered Soymilk Ingredients for North American and Japanese Markets The project aims to build a pilot scale facility to provide further validation of the soymilk powder process developed in a previous project, as well as to build operational capacity to produce the soymilk powder to specification and at scale, in order to complete market assessments.
Project Partners: Alinova Canada, Marusam-AI, Earth's Own Foods, Flamaglo Foods

Project Title: AI-Enhanced Agrifood Value Chain: From Precision Ag Production to Food Ingredient Processor Sustainability This project will be using artificial intelligence (AI) to improve crop production management and sustainability. By enhancing the precision of agricultural practices and increasing the adoption of technologies optimizing input efficiency, this project will reduce agricultural emissions and pesticide use, and establish reliable measurement, reporting, and verification (MRV) models to ensure transparency and traceability throughout the supply chain.
Project Partners: Croptimistic Technology, TheoryMesh, C-Merak

Project Title: Integration of animal-free collagen to enhance plant-based foods & pet nutrition This project is leveraging soluble, gellable collagen technology to enhance plant-based meat analogues and pet nutrition. This consortium aims to enhance the texture and nutritional profile of plant-based meat analogues, incorporate collagen in plant-based pet nutrition products and optimize processes to ensure cost effectiveness of collagen ingredients.
Project Partners: Liven Proteins, ALT-PRO

Project Title: Building a more nutritious future with Canadian proteins This project aims to improve the nutrition, flavour and texture of plant-based products through research. Partners also plan to scale the use of plant-based proteins in savoury, sweet, and shell pastry products.
Project Partners: Tartistes, Wamame Foods

Project Title: Improving Plant-based Cheese Options This project will develop a new line of plant-based cheeses using pulses that aim to overcome the flavor, nutritional, and textural challenges of existing plant-based cheese products.
Project Partners: Daiya Foods, Ingredion Inc., Ingredion Plant Based Protein Specialties Inc., Lovingly Made Flour Mills

Project Title: In-Field Quality Insight for the Supply Chain This project will leverage AI to increase transparency in the food value chain by developing technology to predict and assess protein crops in the field during growing season and harvest.
Project Partners: Ground Truth Agriculture, Parametrics.Ag, C-Merak Innovations, Cas-Grain Farms

Project Title: Advancing Sustainable Protein Solutions This project will advance the commercialization of extrusion technology and help bring new food and ingredients from pea and fava beans to consumers.
Project Partners: Lovingly Made Flour Mills, TMRW Foods, Dutton Farms

Project Title: Low Cost and Sustainable Dry Fractionation of Hemp and Canola This project will validate and use large scale CO2 extraction technologies to create new high-quality protein and flour products from hemp and canola, including protein concentrate and gluten-free flour. Blue Sky also hopes to refine and commercialize food-grade oil or lecithin from secondary oil recovered from canola meal.
Project Partners: Blue Sky Hemp Ventures, THAR Processing, Virtex Grain Exchange

Project Title: Expanding the Canadian Lupin Ecosystem from Farm to Fork This project will conduct work to support the growth and widespread adoption of lupin crops in Canada, as well as a range of activities that contribute to the development, scale-up and improvement of consumer packaged goods and ingredients, including plant-based egg and dairy products, lupin flour and bakery mixes.
Project Partners: Deloitte Inc.

Project Title: Early detection of herbicide resistant weeds in protein crops using AI The project will create a novel AI-powered system to measure the efficacy of herbicides applied to plant protein crops to predict and control herbicide resistances. This system will analyse post-application fields on a plant-by-plant basis and identify specific resistance candidates very early, mapping them out over the field and enabling a precision application of additional herbicide to just those plants in order to control and prevent the proliferation of resistant weeds.
Project Partners: Precision.ai, Global Institute for Food Security (GIFS), GECO Enterprises Ltd, SureGrowth Solutions Ltd

Project Title: Technology Development and Commercialization of New Pulse Protein This project aims to develop new technology and commercialization for pulse proteins, including fava and beans.
Project Partners: Roquette Canada, Prairie Fava, Plant Up, BioNeutra North America

Project Title: Accelerating the Use of Plant-based Protein Isolates This project will source, package, and scale a new reformulated ingredient blend for use in plant-based protein (PBP) consumer-ready products, including modular, ready-to-mix, and ready-to-drink low-volume liquid protein. Project partners will also be building on the success of a previous cluster-funded project to further commercialize and improve consumer-ready products within current and new markets.
Project Partners: Enhanced Medical Nutrition Inc., Acenzia Inc., Gruppo Nutrition Inc.

Project Title: Fueling Canada's Premium Functional Plant-Protein Sector This project will invest in new food technologies and products using local ingredients, while also developing, commercializing, and scaling a diverse range of products featuring sustainable Canadian proteins.
Project Partners: Wamame Foods Inc., AGT Foods and Ingredients Inc, Crush Dynamics Inc, Apex FoodSource Ltd

Project Title: Hybrid Hemp Innovation Value Chain This project will bring together industry leaders to create an innovation value chain that develops hybrid hemp cultivars that meet both the physical and functional traits valued by processors, food ingredient companies, and consumers. This innovation value chain will also create an a system where functional and processing characteristics can be accessed, inputted, and provided feedback on, which will support future innovation in breeding high yielding hemp hybrids that both improve processing efficiency and meet consumer demands for taste and nutrition.
Project Partners: Verve Seed Solutions, Fresh Hemp Foods, Farmers Business Network Canada

Project Title: Creation of High Protein Canola, Utilization of High Protein Canola & Sunflower Building on their successes in two cluster-funded projects, project partners will be working together to further the commercialization, market development, and value realization of high-protein canola, sunflower protein, and novel oilbody products.
Project Partners: Corteva Agriscience, Botaneco, Bunge, Rainfed Foods, Northeast Nutrition

Project Title: Production and Commercialization of Sunflower and Hempseed Protein Isolates The consortium will develop a new line of hemp and sunflower protein ingredients through this project. By adding value to existing, lower-value products, this project will help secure domestic and international supply chains and support Canada's economic growth.
Project Partners: Burcon, HPS Food & Ingredients, Puratos

Project Title: Advancing the Canadian Fava Ecosystem by Empowering Value-Chain Stakeholders Prairie Fava will be working with partners to strengthen the supply of fava beans in the food and ingredients markets, providing consumers with an increased selection of healthy and sustainable food options.
Project Partners: Prairie Fava, Three Farmers, DL Seeds

Project Title: Innovating Pulse and Oat Milled Products to Meet Customers' Requirements for Healthy, Functional, and Sustainable Plant-Based Ingredients This project will incorporate more oats and pulses into food and beverages, such as yogurt, veggie-links, and pastries, to expand the selection of healthy food products to better meet consumer expectations.
Project Partners: Avena Foods, Big Mountain Foods, Danone, Old Dutch

Project Title: Pulse and Grain Protein Fortification and New Product Development in Plant-Based Seafood Products This project will amplify the nutritional content of Konscious Foods' existing line of plant-based seafood products while also developing new products, including nori and tamagoyaki egg products.
Project Partners: Konscious Foods Canada Inc, Canadian Pacifico Seaweeds Ltd., Avena Foods

Project Title: Development of AI/ML based models for predicting the presence anthracnose and/or ascochyta blight and grain moisture content for lentil crop (PCAIS Project) Ukko Agro, Hawk's Agro, and Three Farmers are leveraging AI to help farmers better predict the early presence of anthrocnose and asochyta diseases in lentil crops as well as in-season grain moisture content, enabling more sustainable application of remedies to support crop health and maximize yields.
Project Partners: Ukko Agro Inc., Hawk's Agro Ltd., Three Farmers Inc.

Project Title: Pilot Demonstration, Optimization and Scale Up of Plant-based Salmon This project is a follow-on to New School's first project, where they successfully worked with Liven to prove out the technology necessary to formulate a full, muscle-cut type product. This project builds on the success of that project to focus on scaling up production and the sale of a fully commercial, market-ready product. This product brings improved technology and better processing, ultimately leading to a premier, commercially available product.
Project Partners: New School Foods Inc., Liven Protein Corp., Nuwave Research Inc.

Project Title: AI-driven Crop Sentry Device for Real-Time Autonomous 3D Crop Measurement (PCAIS Project) This project contributes to several important desired outcomes, including accelerated innovation with respect to producing plant-based ingredients and food of the future. Specifically, this includes fast-track variety development and product formulation to help Canadian firms create new products faster, and consistent with market expectations of plant-based foods, which includes a focus on quality.
Project Partners: Enns Brothers Ltd., Crop Sentry Ltd., DL Seeds Inc., AGT Food and Ingredients

Project Title: An Indigenous Strategy for Re-energizing Traditional Wild Rice, Creating a Plant Protein Industry for the Prairies This project aims to create a consistent cultivated wild rice supply chain within Indigenous communities by identifying the best prairie-growing wild rice varieties with higher protein content, conducting assessments on which ones are a viable economic fit for Indigenous communities to grow, and training Indigenous communities to grow wild rice. The crops will also be commercialized through partners and undergo recipe development and testing to determine the use of wild rice within Indigenous foods.
Project Partners: Myera, Southeast Resource Development Center, Louis Riel Capital Corporation/MMEF, R&L Acres, Urmatt, Future Food Systems, MITACS

Project Title: Protein Concentrate Development from Canola Meal This project will explore the use of alternative methods, such as desolventization (the removal of solvent from a solid by thermal means), as well as dry fractionation and extraction, to isolate protein from canola meal. The project partners aim to manufacture canola protein concentrates on a large scale while lowering the carbon footprint that would typically result when using existing production processes.
Project Partners: AGT Food and Ingredients, Ulivit, FCL

Project Title: Social Entrepreneurship Enclave - Start-Up Ecosystem Infrastructure This project will start by building out a CRM of relevant companies by answering questions about where companies are located, which stage of business they're at, capital raises to date, etc. It will then provide a visual representation of our ecosystem map, host a startup bootcamp for those identified companies, with a demo day, and host an investor summit that showcases them.
Project Partners: Social Entrepreneurship Enclave, Spring Activator, Whisk Labs

Project Title: The Effect Of Grain-Free Legume Rich Diets on Canine Amino Acid Metabolism and Cardiac Function This project will compare four distinct diets comprising majority of market share to investigate the type of diet and ingredients associated with the development of dilated cardiomyopathy (DCM) in dogs. This study will account for gaps and design flaws in previous studies, such as uncontrolled diets and accurate parameters for depicting systemic taurine concentration.
Project Partners: Pulse Canada, AGT Food & Ingredients, BSM Partners

Project Title: The Use Of Pulse And Grain Proteins To Produce Novel Plant-Based Seafood Products This project will develop more than thirty nutritious and appealing clean-label plant-based seafood products. The products will be priced competitively against existing options while offering significant advantages in terms of nutrition, flavour, texture, and environmental sustainability.
Project Partners: Konscious Foods Canada, Merit Functional Foods, Canadian Pacifico Seaweeds, University of Saskatchewan, Saskatchewan Food Development Centre

Project Title: The ChickPea Protein Revolution - New Frontiers in Plant Protein The project aims to use chickpea proteins to develop new and innovative products to address the consumer demand for novel high-protein, plant-based options. The consortium plans to increase the cumulative plant-based protein knowledge and research in Canada, and catalyze a significant and sustainable impact on the Canadian chickpea supply chain.
Project Partners: Humble and Frank Foods, InnovoPro, Sliced FC, Sobeys

Project Title: Clean-Label Soy Protein, Free of Hexane The project focuses on developing a unique proprietary process to produce a clean-label soy protein to satisfy the growing demand for non-GMO hexane-free soybean protein in the market. The partners are removing hexane from the soy protein extraction process to supply manufacturers, retailers and consumers with a 'cleaner' product, better aligning with consumer demands for clean-label plant-based foods and ingredients.
Project Partners: New Protein International, Kanematsu Corporation, Huron Commodities, Hensall Co-Operative, University of Guelph, Agriculture & Agri-food Canada, JL Richards & Associates Limited, North America Construction

Project Title: Evaluating The Opportunity for a High-value Soymilk Powder Processing Facility in Eastern Canada This project will examine the technical feasibility and costs associated with manufacturing a 'Made-in-Canada' high-value powdered soymilk beverage, and marketing of the final product to consumers in Japan and North America.
Project Partners: David John Hendrick International, ProSoya, Eastern Canada Oilseed Development Association, Field to Fork AgriSystems Consulting, Hendrick Consulting Company

Project Title: Commercialization of Oat Milk Concentrates This project will develop and commercialize cost-effective oat milk concentrates using innovative processing methods to address the increasing demand for oat-based products.
Project Partners: Plant Veda Foods, HPP Canada, Thirstea Beverages, Avena Foods

Project Title: Upcycling Fibre From Pulse Processing into Sustainable Micronutrient Fertilizer This project will support the development of the first ever commercial-scale manufacturing facility for a micronutrient fertilizer, Soileos. The fertilizer uses low value pea and lentil hulls left over during processing, bringing value to traditionally low-value by-products.
Project Partners: Lucent BioSciences, AGT Foods and Ingredients, NuWave Research, IN10T, Aberhart Ag Solutions

Project Title: Micro-Credentialing of Indigenous Youth to Work in Food and Ingredient Processing/Manufacturing Businesses Project partners are working to develop a new micro-credential post-secondary program for Indigenous youth in Western Canada. The program will offer skills that will help Indigenous youth gain employment in the food processing sector, as well as network with processing business leaders, Indigenous Elders, Chiefs and Council, and other Indigenous youth.
Project Partners: Saskatchewan Indian Institute of Technologies, Whitecap Dakota First Nation

Project Title: Increasing Canada's Training and Capacity in Chemical and Food Science Technologies This project focuses on developing two new three-year Diploma programs at Assiniboine Community College (ACC) to address the challenges presented and to provide talent to fill opportunities in plant protein processing and other food and beverage manufacturing across Canada.
Project Partners: Assiniboine College, Roquette Canada

Project Title: Project Helia --- Extraction of Sunflower Proteins Project partners are working on adding substantial value to the sunflower value chain. Their approach is to work on a new protein extraction technology to produce 90% sunflower protein isolate from the cold-pressed sunflower feed currently used for animal feed.
Project Partners: Burcon NutraScience, Persall Fine Foods, University of Manitoba, Saskatchewan Food Industry Development

Project Title: Commercialization of unique vegan products using fava ingredients This project will result in several new, high-value Canadian consumer packaged good (CPG) products. Partners will utilize grown-in-Canada protein in novel in-house technologies to create line extensions and new consumer-winning foods. They will also be testing fava flour in a new tofu line, with the goal of developing a fava tofu, and a blended fava/chickpea tofu.
Project Partners: Prairie Fava, Big Mountain Foods, Prairie Research Kitchen, Cereals Canada, Quality Food Design

Project Title: Plant Protein Atlantic: Exploring the value of plant proteins in the Atlantic Region The intention of the project is to explore and quantify the value of plant proteins in the Atlantic Region in three parts: asset mapping, value-chain analysis, and a food system literacy program and creating careers in agriculture and food.
Project Partners: Eastern Canada Oilseed Development Alliance, Dalhousie University, University of Prince Edward Island, Field to Fork Agrisystems Consulting

Project Title: Regulatory Centre of Excellence The project is focused on generating data to inform and support changes to Canadian regulatory frameworks that currently impede the food industry's ability to communicate the presence of plant protein to consumers, as well as developing a Regulatory Centre of Excellence to assist companies in the sector. The partners will focus on protein labelling claims, naming conventions around plant-based foods, discretionary fortification of simulated plant-based meat and poultry products, and the use of animal testing in determining protein content.
Project Partners: Pulse Canada, Plant-Based Foods, Loblaws, Humane Society International

Project Title: Plant Forward: The Canadian plant-based food, feed and ingredient international conference This project consists of planning and executing the first Canada-led international conference on plant-based food and ingredients. Pulse Canada, Plant-Based Foods of Canada and Protein Industries Canada will plan and host Plant Forward.
Project Partners: Pulse Canada, Plant-Based Foods of Canada

Project Title: Oat Protein, Canada's Hero Ingredient This project will incorporate Canadian-processed oats into Oat Canada's range of oat-based dairy alternative products. Up to this point, Oat Canada has sent Canadian oats outside of the country for processing before importing them back to Canada to use them in their oat-based ingredients. Working with Roquette will allow them to develop a new oat-based protein ingredient processed in Canada leading to benefits for both companies. At the same time, Oat Canada will test the oat protein in several new beverages and dry products, such as protein powder.
Project Partners: Oat Canada, Roquette Canada, Niagara College Canada, GFR Ingredients, University of Alberta

Project Title: Developing novel food safe plant-based protein ingredients of the future This project focuses on building innovation throughout the supply chain starting with the use of different field applications to improve the protein yield in pulses. The next step is adopting technology from another industry and applying Modify Wave Technology to the pre-processing stage. This technology will improve the pre-processing of crops, including the removal of non-soluble fibres and reducing contaminants, that will lead to enhanced processing outcomes. The final step involves employing a wet fractionation process that will remove non-soluble fibres and will extract as much as protein possible, resulting in a high protein ingredient.
Project Partners: More Than Protein Ingredients, SiccaDania, Quantum Mechanical Technology, Hammam Ag. Research, Food Processing Development Centre, National Research Centre

Project Title: Transformational Changes to the Sustainable Protein Research Network This project aims to bridge the gap between Manitoba's protein research and processing sectors by developing a publicly available asset map that details the research expertise and infrastructure related to sustainable protein activities in the province of Manitoba.
Project Partners: University of Manitoba, Enterprise Machine Intelligence and Learning Initiative (EMILI)

Project Title: National Index on Agrifood Performance This project is leading phase 2C of the National Index on Agri-Food Performance. With the overall Index project focused on developing a set of sustainability indicators and metrics related to Canada's agriculture and agri-food industry, phase 2C will focus on developing selected sub-indicators, scoping out data platforms and verification protocols, and developing a series of papers to inform the index and policy implications. All of which will help prove Canada's plant-based foods and ingredients are as environmentally, economically and socially sustainable as consumers are demanding they be.
Project Partners: Pulse Canada, Global Institute for Food Security Ag Tech Enterprise, Alberta Biodiversity Monitoring Institute, Alltech, Arrell Food Institute, Bayer Crop Science, Birds Canada, BMO, Canadian Agri-Food Sustainability Initiative, Canadian Aquaculture Industry Alliance, Canadian Federation of Agriculture, Canadian Horticultural Council, Canadian Produce Marketing Association, Canadian Roundtable for Sustainable Beef, Canadian Roundtable for Sustainable Crops, Canadian Wildlife Federation, Cereals Canada, Chicken Farmers of Canada, Le Conseil de la transformation alimentaire du QuÃ©bec, Corteva, CropLife Canada, DMci Strategies, Ducks Unlimited Canada, Enterprise Machine Intelligence & Learning Initiative (EMILI), Farm Credit Canada, Federated Co-operatives Limited, Fertilizer Canada, Fisheries Council of Canada, Food & Beverage Canada, Food, Health, Consumer Products Canada, Loblaw Companies Limited, Manitoba Agriculture & Resource Development, Maple Leaf Foods, Nutrien, Olds College, Ontario Cattle Feeders' Assocation & Ontario Corn-Fed Beef, Protein Consortium, Manitoba, Protein Industries Canada, Standards Council of Canada, Syngenta, TrustBix, Agriculture & Agri-Food Canada, Environment & Climate Change Canada, Statistics Canada, Canadian Forage & Grasslands Association, Deans Council -- Agriculture, Food & Veterinary Medicine

Project Title: Attracting capital to Canada's plant-based food, feed and ingredient sector The goal of this project is to fund the establishment of a $200 million fund of deployable capital for Canadian ingredient processors. This project will use government support in order to set up the fund and research to identify pockets of investor capital. This capital will fund processing capacity, educate investors, leverage the generational market to support small- and medium-sized enterprises in Canada, and set up an advisory board of subject matter experts, industry representatives, and Indigenous leadership to help lead the fund.
Project Partners: Bellwoods Partners, Champlin Advisory, Deloitte, Osler

Project Title: Ivey Executive Education to increase business sophistication and ability to access capital Partners are working together to build a custom, world-class, executive education and training program to boost the all-around business and leadership acumen of PIC members who are looking to scale. The aim of this program is to provide participants with knowledge and understanding of sought-after business acumen on topics that will enable to them to position themselves as industry leaders, and attract capital investments.
Project Partners: Protein Industries Canada, The Ivey Academy at Western University

Project Title: Growing Canada's Plant-Based Cultured Cheese Sector This project aims to elevate Canada's role in the rapidly growing non-dairy cheese industry. This includes investments into Canadian grown input materials; scaling production capacity; investments into the sales channel including revamping Save-on-Foods' own cheese section to include Canadian plant-based alternatives; new technologies for precession fermentation to improve product quality; and finally the development of unique bacterial culture sets that will enable the entire industry to access the same building blocks dairy cheese producers have had for centuries but now developed specifically for plant-based ingredient input.
Project Partners: Lumi Foods, Save-On-Foods, Wine Crush Technology, Provision Analytics, University of Alberta, Mera Food, Koralta Agri-Food, InnovoPro, University of British Columbia

Project Title: Upskilling Talent in the Agrifood Sector This project is focused on designing and delivering a upskilling pilot program in digital skills in the agrifood sector in Saskatchewan. The project includes research and consultation with key stakeholders and industry partners to determine the most pressing needs of the agrifood industry, and develop a short program to meet the demands of employers.
Project Partners: Palette Skills, University of Saskatchewan

Project Title: Creating a Lupin Ecosystem in Canada - From the Seed to Fork The goal of this project is to develop a closed loop farm-to-fork approach for this high value protein crop to improve access to ingredients and respond to demand while increasing diversification options for western Canadian farmers.
Project Partners: Lupin Platform, Hensall Co-op, PURIS, The Saskatchewan Food Industry Development Centre, Lumi Foods, Canadian International Grains Institute, AgCall, Aratinga Extracts, Can-Seed Equipment, Food Assure, Food Connections, Food Development Centre, Frontier CFO, Intertek Canada, Mera Food Group, Red River College, University of Manitoba

Project Title: Development of nutritionally and functionally superior plant-based milk, yogurt, and eggs using Canadian ingredients This project will solve technical challenges in formulating plant-based milk, probiotic-rich yogurt and dairy alternatives, and other functional plant-based analogues, with a key focus on maintaining the nutritional content and equivalency to conventional products for the consumer packaged goods market.
Project Partners: YoFiit, Avena Foods, Roquette Canada

Project Title: Building the Fermentation Ecosystem This project will bring partners together to strengthen the use of fermentation processing technology in western Canada's plant-based ingredients ecosystem. The partners will also develop a new fermentation program that will enable the commercialization of new technology that will aid small- and medium-sized enterprises across Western Canada in launching new plant-based food and beverage products into the consumer market.
Project Partners: The Saskatchewan Food Industry Development Centre, University of Saskatchewan, Ag-West Bio, The Global Agri-Food Advancement

Project Title: Developing Extraordinary Canadian Plant-based Finished Products Scaled Through Global Partnerships This project focuses on the development and sales of Japanese inspired plant-based food products. Using a combination of Canadian raw materials and Canadian research & development to build products for sale through two of Japan's leading food companies. This project's main objective is to rapidly expand into a proven but niche market for Japanese style plant-based products - establishing Canadian-based Wamame's Waygu brand as a dominant global player.
Project Partners: Wamame Foods Inc., Azuma Foods Canada, Merit Functional Foods, The Saskatchewan good Industry Development Centre, University of British Columbia (UBC), Winecrush, Wismettac Asian Food US

Project Title: Food & Beverage Sector Supply Chain Mapping This project will create a national platform that connects local and provincial tools to enable the businesses and organizations that comprise Canada's food system, including the plant protein segment, to work together locally, provincially and nationally. This new level of connectivity and collaboration will help to address supply chain challenges, find domestic solutions to disruptions, promote innovation across the value chain and increase the resilience and value of the sectors involved.
Project Partners: The McGill Centre for the Convergence of Health and Economics, Conseil de la Transformation Alimentaire du QuÃ©bec (CTAQ), Food and Beverage Canada, Food and Beverage Atlantic, Food and Beverage Ontario, Food and Beverage Manitoba, BC Food and Beverage, Bivizio, University of Ottawa

Project Title: Pea++, Innovative Way of Breeding for Plant Protein This project will develop new pea and hemp varieties for use in plant-protein ingredient processing. The partners are focusing on increasing the protein content and altering the starch content of their varieties, in order to improve functionality, texture and nutrition of ingredients.
Project Partners: NRGene Canada, Farmer's Business Network (FBN), Pulse Genetics, Manitoba Harvest

Project Title: EMILI Data Initiative These project partners are coming together to enhance the Canadian plant-based food, feed and ingredients ecosystem's use and knowledge of data by: 1. Exploring the current state of the data ecosystem in Canadian agri-food; 2. Performing research into knowledge gaps related to data; 3. Developing data-related training programs; and, 4. Creating a project-specific working group.
Project Partners: Enterprise Machine & Intelligence Learning Initiative (EMILI), Alberta Data Institute (ADI)

Project Title: Advancing Innovation in the Indigenous Agriculture/Agrifoods This project will work to develop a national Indigenous Innovation Strategy for the Agriculture and Agrifood Sector, with a focus on establishing food sovereignty, creating job opportunities and business growth for Indigenous groups across Canada.
Project Partners: Indigenous Works, University of Saskatchewan, Nutrien Ag Solutions, University of Regina, Farm Credit Canada

Project Title: Enhancing Plant Based Seafood These project partners will be working together to develop a new line of plant-based seafood products with a focus on whole muscle, fish fillet alternatives that emulate the same texture, taste and cooking experience of fish, creating a product that appeals to the mass-market consumer.
Project Partners: New School Foods Inc, Liven Proteins Corp

Project Title: Adding value to Canadian pea and canola proteins and finished products through functionalization and sensory improvements This project will develop a slate of new ingredients and consumer-facing products using a mix of pea and canola protein. This project will allow the partners to move from sourcing their plant-based protein ingredients from international sources to a Canadian source, improving their sustainability and strengthening Canada's economy
Project Partners: Merit Functional Foods Corporation, The Winning Combination Inc., Daiya Foods, Grand River Foods

Project Title: Commercializing an Innovative Canadian Technology to Manufacture High Quality, Clean Label, Plant-based Protein Ingredients This project is developing a proprietary process to produce high-quality soybean protein ingredients and soybean oil that comply with non-genetically modified and organic labelling standards resulting in clean-label protein ingredients derrived from Canadian-grown soybeans. Crops will be processed at a brand-new, first-of-its-kind facility in Canada.
Project Partners: Canada Protein Ingredients (CPI), DJ Hendrick International, Agrocorp Processing, Semences Prograin, Synthesis Network

Project Title: Improving Cost and Energy Efficiency of Pulse Protein This project will further develop and utilize a specialized dry processing technology patented by GrainFrac to create new, high-protein pulse-based ingredients for the non-dairy beverage market. This scale-up will help GrainFrac quantify the environmental benefits associated with the technology's dry processing capabilities, including its reduction in water use.
Project Partners: GrainFrac, Tomtene Seed Farms, Ripple Foods

Project Title: Plant Protein Efficacy and Evidence: a New Gold-Standard This project will use ethically-sourced, Canadian materials and manufacturing to develop new plant-based protein powders similar to whey protein. The protein powders will be made available for clinical and athletic consumers.
Project Partners: Enhanced Medical Nutrition, Infinit Nutrition Canada, McMaster University

Project Title: Agrifood Opportunity Awareness for Youth (AOAFY) Project partners are working together to help address the agriculture industry's growing need for a skilled workforce. This project will expand existing STEM programing for students in kindergarten to Grade 12 throughout Western Canada, to generate awareness and interest in career opportunities in plant protein, agrifood and digital agriculture. The program, targeted to reach 69,000 youth over three years, will focus on students in Alberta, Saskatchewan and Manitoba, with emphasis placed on Indigenous, inner-city and rural/remote students.
Project Partners: EMILI, Actua, Agriculture in the Classroom

Project Title: Exploiting the Potential of Tempered Whole Pulse Flours This project will test and develop new applications for proprietary tempered pulse flours. These tempered pulse flours are poised to help meet the fast-growing market demand for plant-based proteins and products in the growing vegan and flexitarian markets, both in North America and overseas.
Project Partners: Avena Foods Ltd., Big Mountain Foods, Daiya Foods, Bakenology, The Village Bakery

Project Title: Development of New Plant Protein Products for Domestic and Asian Markets This project will use Western Canadian commodities such as oats, lentils, hemp, fava beans and chickpeas to develop new plant-based protein products and ingredients, dietary alternatives that can be sold to markets in Canada and Asia.
Project Partners: Mera Development Corp., Mera Food Group Inc., Benson Farms, Saskatchewan Food Industry Development Centre (SFIDC), KGS Group, Kenlin Design Group, Process Innovation -- Food Safety, Specialty Process Systems Ltd., Federated Co-operatives Limited

Project Title: Improving Taste and Use of Canadian Pulse Ingredients This project will improve the taste and functionality of pulse-based ingredients. Initially focusing on yellow peas, partners will use physical processing techniques to turn the commodities into ingredients that will be available to food processors and manufacturers in Canada and internationally.
Project Partners: Ingredion Inc., Verdient Foods Inc., T. Base 4 investments Corp., O.M.D. Food Products Corp.
